Class AbstractGameModel

java.lang.Object
com.aoopproject.framework.core.AbstractGameModel
Direct Known Subclasses:
SameGameModel, SokobanModel
public abstract class AbstractGameModel extends Object
An abstract base class for game models in the AOOP Project framework. It manages the fundamental aspects of a game, including:
  • The game board (as a Grid of GameEntitys).
  • The current score.
  • The current GameStatus (e.g., PLAYING, GAME_OVER_WIN).
  • A list of GameObservers to be notified of GameEvents.
  • A history stack (Deque<Object>) for implementing undo functionality.
This class provides a template for action processing by handling common framework actions (New Game, Undo, Quit) in its final processInputAction(GameAction) method and delegating game-specific actions to the abstract processGameSpecificAction(GameAction) method, which must be implemented by concrete game models.

Concrete game implementations (e.g., SameGameModel, SokobanModel) must extend this class and implement all its abstract methods to define game-specific logic for initialization, action processing, validation, win/loss conditions, undo/redo, and view representations.

  • Field Details

    • gameBoard

      protected Grid<? extends GameEntity> gameBoard
      The game board holding game entities. Must be initialized by subclasses.

    • score

      protected int score
      The current score of the game.

    • currentStatus

      protected GameStatus currentStatus
      The current status of the game (e.g., PLAYING, GAME_OVER_WIN).

    • historyStack

      protected final Deque<Object> historyStack
      Stack to store game states for undo functionality. Subclasses manage the type of state objects.

  • Constructor Details

    • AbstractGameModel

      protected AbstractGameModel()
      Constructs an AbstractGameModel. Initializes the list of observers, sets the initial score to 0, the initial game status to GameStatus.INITIALIZING, and initializes the history stack for undo operations.

  • Method Details

    • addObserver

      public final void addObserver(GameObserver observer)
      Adds a GameObserver to the list of observers to be notified of game events. The observer will not be added if it is null or already registered.
      Parameters:
      observer - The GameObserver to add.

    • removeObserver

      public final void removeObserver(GameObserver observer)
      Removes a GameObserver from the list of observers. If the observer is not in the list, this method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      observer - The GameObserver to remove.

    • notifyObservers

      protected final void notifyObservers(GameEvent event)
      Notifies all registered GameObservers about a specific GameEvent. Iterates over a copy of the observer list to allow observers to unregister themselves during event notification without causing a ConcurrentModificationException.
      Parameters:
      event - The GameEvent to propagate to observers. Must not be null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the event is null.

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Gets the current score of the game.
      Returns:
      The current integer score.

    • setScore

      protected void setScore(int newScore)
      Sets the current score of the game. If the new score is different from the current score, it updates the score and notifies all registered observers with a "SCORE_UPDATED" GameEvent.
      Parameters:
      newScore - The new score to set.

    • getCurrentStatus

      public GameStatus getCurrentStatus()
      Gets the current status of the game.
      Returns:
      The current GameStatus.

    • setCurrentStatus

      protected void setCurrentStatus(GameStatus newStatus)
      Sets the current status of the game. If the new status is different from the current status, it updates the status and notifies all registered observers with a "STATUS_CHANGED" GameEvent.
      Parameters:
      newStatus - The new GameStatus to set. Must not be null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if newStatus is null.

    • getGameBoard

      public Grid<? extends GameEntity> getGameBoard()
      Retrieves the current game board. The board might be null if the game has not been initialized yet via initializeGame().
      Returns:
      The Grid representing the game board, or null if not initialized.

    • newHighScoreAchieved

      public void newHighScoreAchieved(Object scoreDetails)
      Called to indicate that a new high score has been officially achieved and recorded. The model can then fire an appropriate event (e.g., "NEW_HIGH_SCORE_ACHIEVED") for observers like a sound manager or other UI components to react to.
      Parameters:
      scoreDetails - Optional: Details of the high score, such as the ScoreEntry object or any relevant information. Can be null if the event is just a signal.

    • processInputAction

      public final void processInputAction(GameAction action)
      Central dispatcher for processing all game actions. This method handles common framework-level actions such as starting a new game (NewGameAction), undoing the last move (UndoAction), and quitting the game (QuitAction).

      For actions specific to the concrete game implementation, this method delegates to the processGameSpecificAction(GameAction) method, but only if the game is currently in the GameStatus.PLAYING state.

      This method is final to ensure a consistent action processing pipeline across all game models.
      Parameters:
      action - The GameAction to process. If null, an error is logged.

    • initializeGame

      public abstract void initializeGame()
      Initializes or resets the game to its starting state specific to the concrete game. This typically involves setting up the game board (gameBoard), resetting the score (score), setting the currentStatus (usually to GameStatus.PLAYING), clearing any history (historyStack), and notifying observers with appropriate events like "BOARD_INITIALIZED" and "NEW_GAME_STARTED".

    • processGameSpecificAction

      protected abstract void processGameSpecificAction(GameAction action)
      Processes game-specific actions when the game is in the GameStatus.PLAYING state. Concrete game models (e.g., SameGameModel, SokobanModel) must implement this method to define how actions unique to that game (like tile selections, character movements, or hint requests) affect the game state.

      Implementations should:

      • Validate the game-specific action.
      • If valid, update the game state (board, score, player position, etc.).
      • Push previous state to historyStack if the action is undoable.
      • Notify observers of relevant changes (e.g., "BOARD_CHANGED", "SCORE_UPDATED", game-specific events).
      • Call checkEndGameConditions() if the action could lead to game end.
      • If the action is invalid by game rules (but passed initial type checks), notify observers with an appropriate event (e.g., "INVALID_MOVE", "INVALID_SELECTION").

      Parameters:
      action - The game-specific GameAction to process.

    • isValidAction

      public abstract boolean isValidAction(GameAction action)
      Checks if a given GameAction is currently valid according to the game's rules and state. This method can be used by UI components to enable/disable controls, or by AI to evaluate potential moves. Concrete game models must implement this to reflect their specific validation logic for different actions.
      Parameters:
      action - The GameAction to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the action is currently valid, false otherwise.

    • checkEndGameConditions

      protected abstract void checkEndGameConditions()
      Checks for conditions that signify the end of the game (e.g., win or loss). This method is typically called by concrete models after an action that changes the game state. If an end-game condition is met, this method should update the currentStatus (e.g., to GameStatus.GAME_OVER_WIN or GameStatus.GAME_OVER_LOSE) which will, in turn, notify observers.

    • undoLastMove

      public abstract void undoLastMove()
      Reverts the game state to before the last successfully processed and undoable move. Concrete game models must implement this by popping a saved state from the historyStack and restoring all relevant game attributes (board, score, player position, specific game counters, etc.). After restoring, it should set the status (usually to GameStatus.PLAYING) and notify observers of changes ("BOARD_CHANGED", "UNDO_PERFORMED", etc.).

    • canUndo

      public abstract boolean canUndo()
      Checks if an undo operation can currently be performed. Typically, this means checking if the historyStack is not empty.
      Returns:
      true if an undo operation is possible, false otherwise.
